answers.answer: The main ways to enter Romania are by obtaining temporary protection, with a short-stay right, or as an asylum seeker.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Your rights in Romania depend on your status.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'My rights'.

answers.answer: Someone can apply for asylum within Romania at a later point.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: If you cannot present any documents upon entering Romania, you will need to apply for asylum at the border.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'My rights'.

answers.answer: Temporary protection is a special form of protection for people fleeing the war in Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Temporary protection'.

answers.answer: A temporary protection permit is automatically valid until 03/04/2026, and beneficiaries do not need to apply for an extension.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Temporary protection'.

answers.answer: Ukrainian nationals need to present a valid passport at the border crossing to enter Romania for a short stay.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Short stay'.

answers.answer: Someone with a short-stay right can stay up to 90 days in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Short stay'.

answers.answer: Asylum is a form of protection that allows a foreigner who cannot return to their country of origin to remain in Romania, and they cannot be removed (deported) to their country of origin.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'Applying for asylum'.

answers.answer: In Poland, support can be found by calling the hotline +48 47 721 75 75 or by visiting www.ua.gov.pl and https://pomagamukrainie.gov.pl/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'For support in other European countries'.

answers.answer: Hotlines offering support in other European countries include Poland (+48 47 721 75 75), Moldova (0 8000 15 27), Hungary (+36 1 463 9292), and The Slovak Republic (+421 513 816 111 and +421 259 765 111).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read the section under 'For support in other European countries'.
